description:
2021 is nearly done, and while we firmly believe in the power of positive thinking there might just be a few little things you’d like to get off your chest, ready for a clean start in January...

...and so the ABB team and aspiring punologists bring you...A Christmas Ranto. Share your short stories, your epic wins and terrible defeats, heroes and villains, poisonous apples and awakening kisses.

If all that sounds a bit too theatrical, what we’re really looking for is light hearted lightning talks around 5 to 10 minutes. To be honest, they don't even have to be that ranty. It’s a great opportunity to take to the stage for the first time. More seasoned performers may like to try the dreaded PechaKucha.

Talks should meet the following criteria:
-Something you’re passionate about
-Something the group will enjoy and might learn from
-Kind and inclusive - You’re welcome to share how you overcame a frustrating tool or process, just don’t rant about a person, company, discriminate or over generalise about a group.

If we can figure out how, we’ll vote so you can see how relatable your rant is.

After the talk we’ll raise a glass (or mince pie) in honour of the players and enjoy a natter. Duration will depend on the number of talks, and subsequent sociability.

So, Let us know if you’ve got a talk, or a gem of an idea, we look forward to hearing from you.

By the way, Gemma, Stuart, Ewan and John were hoping this would be an in-person event, and we certainly hope to resume those in the new year. For now though, we’ll play it safe, and hope to see you somewhere soon.

Update: We've had a slow response to this one, which is fine, experimentation is a key part of agility :-) We're going to cancel this, wish you a merry Christmas, and hope to see you next year!
title: A Christmas Ranto
